docs.lead_paragraph: Harking back to America's triumphant race into space, the Obama administration is launching what it calls a "moonshot" effort to cure cancer.

headline.main: Cancer 'Moonshot' Aims to Speed Fight Against No. 2 Killer
headline.print_headline: Cancer 'Moonshot' Aims to Speed Fight Against No. 2 Killer

docs.snippet: Harking back to America's triumphant race into space, the Obama administration is launching what it calls a "moonshot" effort to cure cancer.

docs.lead_paragraph: Excerpts from recent editorials in newspapers in the United States and abroad:

headline.main: Editorial Roundup: Excerpts From Recent Editorials
headline.print_headline: Editorial Roundup: Excerpts From Recent Editorials

docs.snippet: Excerpts from recent editorials in newspapers in the United States and abroad:

docs.lead_paragraph: Mammograms do the most good later in life, a government task force has declared in recommending that women get one every other year starting at age 50. It said 40-somethings should make their own choice after weighing the pros and cons.

headline.main: Task Force: Mammograms an Option at 40, Do More Good at 50
headline.print_headline: Task Force: Mammograms an Option at 40, Do More Good at 50

docs.snippet: Mammograms do the most good later in life, a government task force has declared in recommending that women get one every other year starting at age 50. It said 40-somethings should make their own choice after weighing the pros and cons.

docs.lead_paragraph: A medical panel issued an update to its guidelines Monday, but still says women with average risk of breast cancer can safely begin screening at 50.

headline.main: Panel Reasserts Mammogram Advice That Triggered Breast Cancer Debate
headline.print_headline: Medical Panel Reasserts Advice, Limiting Mammograms, That Triggered a Debate

docs.abstract: Panel of medical experts reasserts 2009 advice that women can safely begin mammograms starting at age 50, rather than age 40 as previously suggested, and be tested every other year; advice, which sparked debate, applies to women with average risk of breast cancer.
docs.snippet: A medical panel issued an update to its guidelines Monday, but still says women with average risk of breast cancer can safely begin screening at 50.

keywords.value: United States Preventive Services Task Force
keywords.name: organizations

docs.lead_paragraph: Mammograms do the most good later in life, a government task force declared Monday in recommending that women get one every other year starting at age 50. It said 40-somethings should make their own choice after weighing the pros and cons.

docs.lead_paragraph: Illumina, a maker of DNA sequencing machines, said it was forming the company to develop a blood test that would work for any type of cancer, but some experts see risks.

headline.main: Illumina Creating Company to Develop Early-Stage Cancer Detection Test
headline.print_headline: Illumina Creating Company to Develop Blood Test to Find Cancer Early

docs.abstract: Illumina, maker of DNA sequencing machines, says it is forming company to develop simple blood test to detect any kind of early stage cancer.
docs.snippet: Illumina, a maker of DNA sequencing machines, said it was forming the company to develop a blood test that would work for any type of cancer, but some experts see risks.
